I always thought that the development of Africa is mainly a political issue, until I delved into the book of Ne Kiana Mazamba "Kindoki: an African mystery elucidated" (www.kianamaz.com). Kiana gives another perception of the problematic of the African development which puts spirituality at the centre. For him the African trouble comes from the destruction of the African spiritual traditional values, this destruction let lose the belief in witchcraft, the main element of that blocks good initiatives on individual and collective level. Mr Kiana gives two solutions: first religion in Africa should be able to help people handle the issue of witchcraft. And secondly spirituality should help African connect with black saints.
